requirements.REQ-SLA-GEN-1: Two types of SLAs persist: Service Provider SLA, Application SLA
requirements.REQ-SLA-GEN-2: Each SLA includes general info on SP/Application and per-NCS information
requirements.REQ-SLA-GEN-3: SP SLA is enforced before Application SLA during provisioning
requirements.REQ-SLA-GEN-4: Application SLA cannot exceed SP SLA level restrictions

requirements.REQ-SP-SLA-1: SP SLA shall be an agreement between SDP and Service Provider
requirements.REQ-SP-SLA-2: Operations-Users have authority to create a Service Provider

requirements.REQ-APP-SLA-1: SP-Users can create an Application SLA
requirements.REQ-APP-SLA-2: Application SLA has two versions: Production SLA and Testbed SLA

sla_parameters.description: Parameters listed in SLA_Attributes v0.5.xls (Appendix A)

requirements.REQ-SLA-PRM-1: SLA parameters configurable by Operations-User and SP-User
requirements.REQ-SLA-PRM-1.1: Two user roles exist: MANAGE_OPERATIONS_LEVEL_SLA_PARAMETERS, MANAGE_APPLICATION_LEVEL_SLA_PARAMETERS
requirements.REQ-SLA-PRM-2: SLA_Attributes file contains General, SMS, MMS, BAS, WAP push, and USSD parameters

requirements.REQ-SHT-CDE-1: Shortcodes used to route request to correct application
requirements.REQ-SHT-CDE-2: Types: Shared shortcode (multiple apps, route by keyword), Exclusive shortcode (unique to one app)
requirements.REQ-SHT-CDE-4: Shortcode should be a regular expression (e.g., '888***', '776****')
requirements.REQ-SHT-CDE-5: New shortcode rejected if subset/superset of existing shortcode
requirements.REQ-SHT-CDE-6: Assigned shortcode used in both Production and Testbed environments

requirements.REQ-KEY-WRD-2: Duplicate keywords not allowed for same shortcode
requirements.REQ-KEY-WRD-3: For shared shortcodes, routing based on [shortcode+keyword] pair
requirements.REQ-KEY-WRD-4: Charging amount can be specified per keyword

charging_details.description: Charging is configured in SLAs for SMS-MO, SMS-MT, MMS-MO, MMS-MT, WAP, and BAS events. CDRs are written for all deliveries including free ones.

requirements.REQ-CHG-PRF-1: Maintain two charging profiles: Local and Global customers
requirements.REQ-CHG-PRF-2: Only local subscribers are applicable for tax

requirements.REQ-CHG-BP-1: Chargee defined in Application SLA per service
requirements.REQ-CHG-BP-2: System checks sender/receiver as billed party

requirements.REQ-CHG-MO-1: Flat rate – single SLA-configured value per MO message
requirements.REQ-CHG-MO-2: Keyword-based flat rate – charged per keyword SLA

requirements.REQ-CHG-MT-1: Flat rate – fixed rate per MT message type (SMS, MMS)
requirements.REQ-CHG-MT-2: Variable rate – charging amount included in message, validated against SLA charging range

rules.REQ-MT-RUL-1: For concatenated messages, charge only once when fully delivered
rules.REQ-MT-RUL-2: User charged only on successful submit response from XMSC
